subject: history
title: Round Table Conferences (1930-1932)
description: Three conferences in London; Gandhi attended second; all failed

rows.first: CDM at peak; Gandhi in jail; British wanted negotiations without Congress
rows.second: After Gandhi-Irwin Pact; CDM suspended; Gandhi released to attend
rows.third: After second phase CDM; Gandhi in jail; Congress not interested

rows.first: Exposed British tactics: divide Indians, avoid Congress, maintain control
rows.second: Gandhi's presence gave international attention; but failed to achieve anything; CDM resumed
rows.third: Showed RTCs meaningless; British would impose reforms anyway; led to GOI Act 1935

gandhiQuotes.title: Gandhi at Second RTC
gandhiQuotes.arrival: Arrived in simple dress; met mill workers in Lancashire (British textile workers hurt by boycott)
gandhiQuotes.quote1: 'I am here as sole representative of Indian National Congress which represents India'
gandhiQuotes.quote2: When asked if he had enough clothing meeting King: 'King has enough for both of us'
gandhiQuotes.meetings: Met PM, Churchill (who hated him), Labour leaders, common people

additionalInfo.communalAward: PM Ramsay MacDonald announced Communal Award (Aug 1932) giving separate electorates to Muslims, Sikhs, Depressed Classes, etc. - Gandhi opposed strenuously
additionalInfo.result: All three conferences failed ‚Üí British imposed Government of India Act 1935 without Indian consensus
additionalInfo.examTip: Remember: 1st-No Congress; 2nd-Gandhi alone; 3rd-No one important. All failed. Led to GOI Act 1935
